content.prompt: The British actions described in the passages best explain which of the following reactions in the late nineteenth century?

choices.label: Rival European states, such as France and Germany, sought to draw Britain into alliance structures in order to minimize conflict over overseas empires.
British colonial subjects who received a western education created nationalistic movements to resist imperialism.
Many European countries began to lower trade barriers in order to take advantage of British colonial imports.
European states created state-run trading companies to manage profits from colonial exports.

skill.text: Skill 5.B: Explain how a historical development or process relates to another historical development or process.
